channel.title: Runserver.bat
channel.description: can someone supply me with coding for a early version of pi, old graphics and everything like old runescape... i just need a runserver as i deleted it accidently when i dled the source ( no im not going to download the source again ) i know it starts off and ends like: @echo title: (title here) ( i need the code that goes here ) pause

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

@echo off title Server java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server release nogui pause

Read full topic

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @Tech_Python Tech Python
item.description:
@Tech_Python wrote:

i got the runerserver.bat running… the path was just messed up completely … i now have a problem with my client…
it opens the client up, but on the loading screen it says: error connecting retrying in 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 … and then it says it again… like a loop… any suggestions?

Read full topic

nah still get same error… wtf’s eclipse? … and why is making a runserver.bat so difficult? … can someone tv me it?

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Tech Python, post:10, topic:412247”]wow, that was close, but no cigar… i get this error now:
Usage:
java com.rs.Server [debug/release] [gui/nogui]
Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

What server did you download from the server download section?
Look it up in your ‘downloads’ folder on your computer, open the source, view the .bat file and use that.

item.title: Runserver.bat
item.dc:creator: @Tech_Python Tech Python
item.description:
@Tech_Python wrote:

ok, my server class is located in: Bin>server>server … so i put this
java bin/server/server
and it has come up with the following error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: bin/server/server (wr ong name: server/Server) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: bin/server/server. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

EDIT: Only if you don’t have the path to jdk set. "C://Program files/java/jdk0.0_27/bin/java.exe"
Or something like this.
